main event: An unidentified aerial object was sighted over Albuquerque, New Mexico on March 15, 1950. The object was described as a tear drop shape with a core of greenish-white light that appeared to burn out in approximately 1 1/2 seconds.
interesting points: The object was about three times the size of a shooting star and had a reddish-brown glow behind it.
It fell straight down with no apparent tactics or maneuvers, and had a small trail of sky rocket effect.
The observer was a student in Journalism at the University of New Mexico who became interested in strange air phenomena, and there were no logical leads to explain the sighting.
This report was part of the historical U.S. Air Force program Project Blue Book that investigated unidentified flying objects.
The document was also sent to the Wright-Patterson Air Force Base for further analysis.
witnesses: Cristino B. Griego, University of New Mexico student
